overview:
As a business development director and product strategist at Pyra Labs, Jason was part of of a revolution in mass communication, Blogger. Shellen & Evan Williams sold the company to the search giant Google in 2003. During his tenure at Google, Shellen started the Google Reader project & became it’s founding product manager, worked on a plug-in hybrid project for Google.org and helped acquire companies like Feedburner, Picasa & Measure Map.

After leaving Google, Shellen founded Thing Labs in 2008 and created social tools Plinky, Brizzly, the Brizzly Guide, & Let’s Be Trends. In September of 2010, Thing Labs merged with AOL. Shellen became VP of Product heading up the AIM & Messaging Group at AOL and guided the combined teams in a relaunch and rebrand of AIM.

In May of 2012, Shellen co-founded Tapedeck with longtime collaborator Zachary Taylor. Tapedeck is currently working on a new sharing application with hopes to change the way we interact with content.

Shellen advises and mentors several companies and organizations, holds patents on feed and social media technologies and for the last two years has been named to Business Insider’s “Silicon Valley 100” list, a compendium of people in the Valley who have “done the coolest things”. Jason resides in Lafayette, California with his wife Allison and their two sons.

Source: shellen.com

relationships.title: Product Manager / New Business Development Manager
